bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October [21?], 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed describes surveying and map making. He relates the news of Major Patterson's death and his wife's suicide.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October [21?], 1900
div1.p:
Your letter of the
14th reached me this morning
and I enjoyed reading it
before I got up. As I was
taking a good long rest
after what might be called
a good days work yesterday
As a part of our instruction
we are making surveys of
the surrounding country
and then make proof maps
of our work. I was out
from 7 yesterday morning
until about 5 in the afternoon
as suppose and imagine I walked 15 miles
so of course was quite tired
when I went to bed

Well Dearest I suppose
you are extremely happy to-day
for if I am not mistaken
Father is spending this Sunday
with you

I suppose you have
heard the awful news of Maj
Petterson's death and the sad way
his wife ended her life. I
knew him and was very fond
of him and must say we are
all much grieved over his
death, he was once a second
Lieut in this regiment.

We are still enjoying
fine weather and our bathing
is simply fine.

I told you all the news
last time so will make this
short. & will write again soon
With lots of love for all
